text: - Virginia is a beautiful place
to grow up, to raise children.
After being here for 40 plus years

I'm still discovering
new things day to day.
I'm D'Andrea Thomas.

I'm a data center engineering
operations technician

for AWS and our IAD
cluster of data centers
which is Northern Virginia.
I always got the running joke

that the crane is the state
bird, not the cardinal,

because this place has been
under construction since 1980,
since I was a little kid.
There'll always be constant growth
and change and evolution here.

There's no opportunity
that your family can't have
to pursue the dreams they want to live.

- I've kind of always
wanted to go into tech

but I assumed that it
would be harder to get in.

I thought I had to be the
smartest person in the room.
I thought I had to wear like geeky glasses
and know all those codes and stuff.
But no, we can all be scientists.
I am Mariam Abidongun-Johnson.

I'm a decom tech at one of
the data centers in Virginia.
AWS has a program called Career Choice
which gives you the opportunity to go back
to school if you choose to.
My current role is as a decom technician
but I'm also a student

at Northern Virginia
Community College (NOVA)

studying to be a EOT,
engineering operation technician.

What they do is they maintain
the physical infrastructure
of our data centers, which is very, very
very important to me.

And that's why I wanna
take up the next challenge
from being decom going to EOT.

- So AWS and NOVA has a
very dynamic relationship
even outside of my involvement.
My name is Amir Mehmood.

I'm an associate
professor and program head
at Northern Virginia Community College

and I'm also a technical
instruction manager
at data center learning at AWS.
When you are coming into this program
not only you are changing role,

but basically you are
getting your academic skills
and your education and our aim is this,

that you go from this
program to all the way

to the bachelor's degree
and change your life.

- There's so much that can
be done in the community

and when you have a partner
that can increase your reach,
then it just, it's like the perfect storm.
I am Navara Cannon.

I am the community and
volunteer engagement manager
for Northern Virginia Family Service.

Our mission is to meet
families and individuals

where they are in their
life and connect them

with resources so that they
can thrive in their community.

We have six projects going
at one time with AWS.
We just recently received

the Hunger Resource
Center refrigerated van.

So in addition to picking up
food, we are starting to go
to the communities who can't get to us

and distribute food
right from the community.

- At Amazon and AWS, customer
and community obsession
is what we hold to our core.
I am Mishtee Chatterjee and I lead
the AWS infrastructure operations here
in the Northern Virginia area.
AWS in communities is the infrastructure

or the data center arm of
empowering the communities.
We want to be a good neighbor,

so we truly go out there
and build those relationship

in the communities in
which we work and live.

- I would never wanna see
the sense of community change
in this area, no matter how big it gets.
I'm Bernie Spencer.

I'm here at Spencer's Safe and
Lock in Sterling, Virginia.
The growth is good for small businesses

and it's been great for
Spencer's Safe and Lock.
Here we are, a small locksmith company,
fell into working with the data centers
and we've grown with the data centers,

hiring more people, always
looking for new people.
- People think of the data centers
just having a few people inside
where it's really not the case.

I'm Rob Clubb, I'm a
cluster security manager
here in northern Virginia
and I manage all things physical security
for 12 data centers and a warehouse.

My team really enjoys
going out to eat together.

We try to go to a lot of
our local establishments.

A lot of us have built
relationships with some
of our local restaurant owners

and we like to frequent
a lot of the same spots.
So we work really hard but we also get out
and we have fun, too.
- Coming from a tavern owner,

the most expensive thing we
have in here is an empty seat.

I am Jimmy Cirrito and we are
at Jimmy's Old Town Tavern
in beautiful downtown Herndon, Virginia.

It helps to have people
moving into the town

or coming here to work
that want to come out.

Now it's our job to make
sure their food is hot
and their beer is cold.
- I've been a lot of places in the world

and this place always
keeps me coming back.
The data centers that AWS built

in Virginia have allowed
humble guys like me

that come from the trades,
an opportunity to live

in the place that they grew
up and not have to move away.
This is just, this is home.
